node.contents: I am having a hell of a time with Gson and ProGuard. I have a simple object and when I parse tojson, save to sqllite and read back from the database in order to load the json back to my object, I get a java.lang.classcastexception. If I dont use ProGuard, everthing works fine.

node.contents: @blindstuff You shouldn't add -libraryjars. In this document, http://proguard.sourceforge.net/index.html#manual/troubleshooting.html, it says "You should never explicitly specify the input jars yourself (with -injars or -libraryjars), since you'll then get duplicate definitions."

astNode.text: @blindstuff You shouldn't add -libraryjars. In this document, http://proguard.sourceforge.net/index.html#manual/troubleshooting.html, it says "You should never explicitly specify the input jars yourself (with -injars or -libraryjars), since you'll then get duplicate definitions."

node.contents: I think if someone wants to keep all classes in the Models package he should write: `-keep class com.someapp.android.models.** { *; }`

astNode.text: I think if someone wants to keep all classes in the Models package he should write: `-keep class com.someapp.android.models.** { *; }`

node.contents: These settings in the config worked for me in one of my apps:

astNode.text: These settings in the config worked for me in one of my apps:

elements.contents:
# Add the gson class
-keep public class com.google.gson

# Add any classes the interact with gson
-keep class com.someapp.android.models.ChatModel { *; }
-keep class com.someapp.android.models.FeedModel { *; }

# Add the path to the jar
-libraryjars /Users/someuser/Documents/workspace/someapp/lib/gson-1.7.1.jar

fragments.text:
.google.gson

# Add any classes the interact with gson
-keep

units.rawText:

node.contents: It does look like your are keeping everything from your class (fields, methods and the class itself). But to make sure you can add -printseeds outputfile.txt to the proguard.cfg file to verify that proguard really keeps everything you need once obfuscation is done.

astNode.text: It does look like your are keeping everything from your class (fields, methods and the class itself). But to make sure you can add -printseeds outputfile.txt to the proguard.cfg file to verify that proguard really keeps everything you need once obfuscation is done.

node.contents: BTW, you might think about adding something like ACRA or Android Remote stacktrace that allows you to inspect stacktraces on a built app.

node.contents: I know the original question was resolved by taking a different approach, but I was having a very similar issue using flexjson and Proguard on Android, and I've solved it, in case anyone runs into it themselves.

astNode.text: I know the original question was resolved by taking a different approach, but I was having a very similar issue using flexjson and Proguard on Android, and I've solved it, in case anyone runs into it themselves.

node.contents: When converting back from JSON to my value object which included some ArrayLists, I would get the same ClassCastException. I got it to work by basically having obfuscation enabled but turning all parts of obfuscation off (-keep everything, -keepclassmembers everything and -keepattributes everything) and then working backwards by enabling things a bit at a time.

astNode.text: When converting back from JSON to my value object which included some ArrayLists, I would get the same ClassCastException. I got it to work by basically having obfuscation enabled but turning all parts of obfuscation off (-keep everything, -keepclassmembers everything and -keepattributes everything) and then working backwards by enabling things a bit at a time.

node.contents: I was able to use the flexjson library without incident after that in a proguarded, release version of my app.

node.contents: gson uses reflection at runtime to dynamically map the json into classes by string matching the properties. This will never work with obfuscated sources, since model.name is replaced with a.b by Proguard. It has less to do with GSON specifically and more to do with any library that uses reflection in this manner. In order to use proguard with GSON, you need to exclude the classes you are serializing / deserializing from obfuscation in the proguard config file.

astNode.text: gson uses reflection at runtime to dynamically map the json into classes by string matching the properties. This will never work with obfuscated sources, since model.name is replaced with a.b by Proguard. It has less to do with GSON specifically and more to do with any library that uses reflection in this manner. In order to use proguard with GSON, you need to exclude the classes you are serializing / deserializing from obfuscation in the proguard config file.

node.contents: Welcome to 2014 where 577Kb and 260Kb are equally nothing.

astNode.text: Welcome to 2014 where 577Kb and 260Kb are equally nothing.

node.contents: So, I ended up ditching the Gson library and instead of converting my object to json using gson, I created a custom class in my app to serialize and deserialize the object and store the data that way.

astNode.text: So, I ended up ditching the Gson library and instead of converting my object to json using gson, I created a custom class in my app to serialize and deserialize the object and store the data that way.

node.contents: I am overall more happy, even though this has cost me over 12 hours of trying to figure it out. Apparently, PROGUARD and gson must not like each other too much?

astNode.text: I am overall more happy, even though this has cost me over 12 hours of trying to figure it out. Apparently, PROGUARD and gson must not like each other too much?

node.contents: As A HUGELY added benefit to not having to use GSON, I noticed that by taking out the GSON library, my app size is cut in half. My app was 577kb and is now only 260kb after removing the gson lib.

astNode.text: As A HUGELY added benefit to not having to use GSON, I noticed that by taking out the GSON library, my app size is cut in half. My app was 577kb and is now only 260kb after removing the gson lib.

node.contents: The lines needed were:

astNode.text: The lines needed were:

fragments.text:
.misc.Unsafe { *; }
# and keeping the classes that will be serialized/deserialized
